name: hlatjidm
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3
body: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(co(c1, c3, c1), c1))

stmt.origin: syl2an(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2), wceq(co(c1, c3, c1), c1), wcel(c0, clat), wcel(c1, cfv(cbs, c0)))
stmt.pretty: syl2an(c0 ∈ HL, c1 ∈ c2, (c1[c3]c1)= c1, c0 ∈ Lat, c1 ∈(Base ` c0))

|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, chlt), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(co(c1, c3, c1), c1))

body.pretty:
⊢ (c1 ∈ c2 → c1 ∈(Base ` c0))
⊣ (Base ` c0)=(Base ` c0)
⊣ c2 =(Atoms ` c0)

body.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ Lat ∧ c1 ∈(Base ` c0))→(c1[c3]c1)= c1)
⊣ (Base ` c0)=(Base ` c0)
⊣ c3 =(join ` c0)

⊢ ((c0 ∈ HL ∧ c1 ∈ c2)→(c1[c3]c1)= c1)

comment: Idempotence of join operation. Frequently-used special case of ~ latjcom for atoms. (Contributed by NM, 15-Jul-2012.)
